page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF PLYMTREE
page.content: The Parish of Plymtree is on the whole a gently hilly area. There is one main hill, on one side of which is the River Tale and on the other the River Weaver. The River Clyst also rises on the hill. The top contour of the hill is 122 metres and the lowest contour in the area is 38 metres. There are a few small patches of wood- land in the area. There used to be many orchards, and all the farms made cider, but two in paticular were famous. Now few farmers make their own cider. There are some arable fields but most are used for grazing cattle. Most fields have hedges on Devon banks with large trees growing on them - there are few fences. Most of the houses are grouped together in the middle of the village but the farms are scattered all over the area.
